item.title: Amazon offers punctual staff £50 for turning up
item.description: The online shopping giant says it will give a bonus to workers at some sites for good attendance.

item.title: Gym Group sees demand surge as young people lack space at home
item.description: Gym Group says it has seen a "rapid recovery" in membership numbers and plans to open 40 more sites.

item.title: JD Sports perplexed by Footasylum deal knockback
item.description: The competition watchdog says it still has concerns the merger could lead to a worse deal for shoppers.

item.title: Top Gun and Mission: Impossible films delayed due to US Covid spike
item.description: Tom Cruise's movies are put on hold as studios fear a recent US Covid spike will deter cinemagoers.

item.title: Driver shortage: 'I got a big pay rise overnight'
item.description: As the UK's shortage of lorry drivers continues, those with the right skills are very much in demand.

item.title: One in seven bookings failing to show up at restaurants
item.description: A report looking into the issue of no-shows says the hospitality sector loses £17bn a year from it.

item.title: More students turn to crypto investing to plug financial gap
item.description: Three-quarters of students asked by website Save The Student said they had considered dropping out.

item.title: Afghanistan: Facebook says it helped people flee, including staff
item.description: The flight arrived in Mexico City on Wednesday, with 175 Afghan citizens on board, including 75 children.

item.title: McDonald’s hiring 14-year-olds in Oregon amid labour shortage
item.description: An Oregon branch sees flood of applications after failing to recruit older workers.

item.title: Sackler family wins immunity from further opioid litigation
item.description: A US judge has approved a bankruptcy plan for the maker of OxyContin painkillers.

item.title: Portugal changes vaccine rules for UK visitors
item.description: UK visitors no longer need to quarantine for 14 days if they can't prove they are fully vaccinated.

item.title: China steps in to regulate brutal '996' work culture
item.description: Workers in China are fed up with the brutal 12-hour work days once seen as a key driver of success.

item.title: Wetherspoons runs low on beer amid driver shortage
item.description: The pub chain and a Coca-Cola bottler are among firms affected by a shortage of UK lorry drivers.

item.title: Amazon to recruit 55,000 staff for expansion drive
item.description: About 2,500 jobs will be created in the UK, with another 40,000 in the US.

item.title: New eco-petrol baffles a quarter of motorists
item.description: E10 is set to become the new standard petrol, but 24% of drivers are unaware of it, says the RAC.

item.title: JoJo Maman Bebe hikes prices for first time in 5 years
item.description: The baby goods retailer tells the BBC that it has raised prices for the first time in five years.

item.title: UK house price rises accelerate, says Nationwide
item.description: Property prices are 13% higher than at the start of the pandemic, the building society says.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'I was making money, but had no money'
item.description: Honey boss Scott Davies says cash flow problems meant though he was profitable he "had no money".

item.title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
item.description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: The pubs and restaurants counting on Christmas cheer
item.description: In a bid to rebound from Covid plans for this year's festive season are under way.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Can the US crack down on fake vaccination cards?
item.description: As more people are asked to prove vaccination status, a black market in fake health cards has boomed.
